channel.title: Just need to rage
channel.description:
I am getting tired of people just saying " virus " or something like that without posting proof...I mean it DOES happen, and that is a serious problem that is dealt with. But seriously guys, SHOW PROOF. If you going to help the community then help it by being sure.
I admit, I got a keylogger a couple of days back and I took care of that situation.
However, we holler virus or something way too much. It doesn't make sense that we holler it for fun, I mean loggers and trojans alike are a SERIOUS item.
I don't know it normally doesn't bother me, just today it did...I am not saying anybody is wrong, nor am I accusing anybody directly. Just please take the justice of screnning what you find.
-Love <3

item.title: Just need to rage
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:14, topic:390101”][quote author=Mendorphins link=topic=486014.msg3561538#msg3561538 date=1302312813]
It ruins your topic I must admitt. My project tools has a .exe in it and I automatically got “Err… keylogger?”. People need to get better anti-virus systems that don’t scream virus everytime a .exe is detected and actually read the damn code in the .exe beforehand.
[/quote]

My anti-virus went off on your Java Decompiler as well as some of the other .exe’s for trojans, but I didn’t worry about it and deleted them since I wouldn’t use them anyway. Anti-virus was Norton.[/quote]
Yeah, and no offence but sounds typical. I suppose my nan for example wouln’t be able to check the inner code of a .exe so it just flags executables as suspicious for safety sake. Anyway, that would be another topic entirely so yeah… next time I won’t included a .exe, heh.

Read full topic

item.title: Just need to rage
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Mendorphins:

It ruins your topic I must admitt. My project tools has a .exe in it and I automatically got “Err… keylogger?”. People need to get better anti-virus systems that don’t scream virus everytime a .exe is detected and actually read the damn code in the .exe beforehand.

My anti-virus went off on your Java Decompiler as well as some of the other .exe’s for trojans, but I didn’t worry about it and deleted them since I wouldn’t use them anyway. Anti-virus was Norton.

Read full topic

item.title: Just need to rage
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Not much to state about it, we have idiots in this world. People don’t know how to use common sense, and even if that person doesn’t know how to read Java coding, or doesn’t know how to find a virus, he/she could at least Google it or something.

Nevertheless, he does ruin the topic a lot as said before above.

Read full topic

item.title: Just need to rage
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

there’s only one way to effectively avoid viruses: be cautious about what page you visit and/or what you download.

Read full topic

item.title: Just need to rage
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:6, topic:390101”]If you can’t deal with it leave, people will always post “VIRUS!!@#@#@” or “TROGENS@@@#*@!@” because their shitty AV says it is, but most of the time it is a false-positive.[/quote]To be honest, if I had to use AVG I just wouldn’t use an anti virus…

Read full topic

item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Mendorphins:

It ruins your topic I must admitt. My project tools has a .exe in it and I automatically got “Err… keylogger?”. People need to get better anti-virus systems that don’t scream virus everytime a .exe is detected and actually read the damn code in the .exe beforehand.

Very much so agree, I have used your package for a while now and so have several hundred ( thousands ? ) more. It is like youtube in a sense, if you don’t feel there are other good comments about the item then why are you downloading it yourself?
